Description.text: Abu Talib was a lacquer artist, active between ca. 1840-70, who specialized in abstract marbled and "engine-turned" designs. […]

Description.text: This is a relatively early example of a revival in illumination (tazhib) designs which flourished in the 1880s. Subtle allusions to Qur'anic verses are given through the presence of a bee (Q16:68-69) and moth (Q101:4).
